news_header: Market rates showed slight movements with gold prices hitting a record high. Trump announced new tariffs on aluminium and steel, raising inflation concerns.
news_original_title: Valtionlainojen koroissa pieniä liikkeitä – Kullan hinta kohosi jälleen ennätyslukemiin
news_text: On Monday afternoon, market rates experienced small movements, with long-term government debt interest rates slightly positive. The interest rate on a 10-year US loan was 0.6%, while the two-year loan rate dropped to 1.0%. Gold prices rose to a new record, exceeding $2,900 per ounce. President Trump announced plans to impose 25% import duties on aluminium and steel, raising concerns about inflation and its potential impact on the central bank's interest rate policy. The market is awaiting US inflation figures and producer price index data later this week. Additionally, the Japanese yen weakened against other currencies.
